titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of genealogical research materials on the Edmunds, Paxton, Stone, Hough and related families. Materials include: correspondence; family charts; photocopies of newspaper clippings (mostly marriage announcements and obituaries); clippings from various newspapers including the Glassboro Enterprise (1921-1922, 1927), Boston Transcript (1946 - related to genealogical research) and various Philadelphia newspapers (late 1800s and early 1900s); family histories; photostats of photographs; notes (often related to marriages); card files on various family members (very similar to the Edmunds cards in the Worst collection); and printed wedding and birth announcements from the early 20th century to 1966. There is also a bound Edmunds family genealogy (note in volume indicates it is an earlier version of an item in the GSP collection).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
